alert.note: Alert for Curry County Coast; South Central Oregon Coast (Oregon) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Medford (Southwest Oregon and Northern California)
info.headline: High Surf Advisory issued February 12 at 2:39AM PST until February 14 at 7:00PM PST by NWS Medford
info.description: ...BEACH HAZARDS STATEMENT REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM 8 AM PST THIS MORNING THROUGH THIS EVENING... ...HIGH SURF ADVISORY IN EFFECT FROM 4 PM MONDAY TO 7 PM PST TUESDAY... * WHAT...For the Beach Hazards Statement, moderate to high risk of sneaker waves expected. These are waves that run unusually higher up on beaches when compared to other observed waves. For the High Surf Advisory, large, breaking waves of 22 to 25 ft are expected in the surf zone. * WHERE...All beaches and shorelines of Douglas, Coos, and Curry Counties. * WHEN...For the Beach Hazards Statement, from 8 AM PST this morning through this evening. For the High Surf Advisory, from 4 PM Monday to 7 PM PST Tuesday. * IMPACTS...For the Beach Hazards Statement, sneaker waves can sweep up the beach without warning and knock unsuspecting people over and pull them out to sea. For the High Surf Advisory, large breaking waves will create hazardous conditions along and within the surf zone, and could inundate beaches and low lying shorelines. Beach erosion is possible, and exposed infrastructure may be damaged. * View the hazard area in detail at https://www.wrh.noaa.gov/map/?wfo=mfr
info.instruction: Stay away from the surf zone and off of jetties. Area beaches may become hazardous due to dangerous surf conditions. Avoid climbing on rocks and jetties. Stay away from the ocean and remain out of the water to avoid hazardous conditions.

area.areaDesc: Curry County Coast; South Central Oregon Coast
